page.title: 01 ANCIENT MONUMENTS
page.content: Elgin Cathedral is our most prominent monument.It was burned down in 1390 by THE WOLF OF BADENOCH. Ladyhill has the ruins of Elgin Castle , it also has a statue of THE DUKE OF GORDON. Elgin had 5 mills,one of which is working and open to the public to show how flour was made long ago. Grant Lodge was built in 1750.It is an old hunting lodge.It was owned by the SEAFIELDS until it was given to the town by Colonel G.A.Cooper.It is now a public libary and its grounds a park. The LITLE CROSS was the old market cross.it was built in 1402
